reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The International Trade Centre (ITC) is the joint technical assistance agency of the World Trade Organization and the United Nations / UNCTAD. ITC's mission is to foster inclusive and sustainable growth and development through trade and international busin ess development. A particular strength of ITC is its focuses on private sector development particularly internationalization of small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs). Sub-Saharan Africa and least developed countries account for over 70 percent of ITC's technical assistance. ITC is one of the leading providers of Aid for Trade. ITC is a key multilateral partner to Finland in the area of Aid for Trade. In 2013 Finland provided a total of five million euros support to the ITC for two-years. A large part of the support was softly earmarked to promoting intra-regional trade in Eastern Africa. In 2014 ITC reported that it had achieved good results in providing support to SMEs in developing countries to integrate into the international markets (over 1000 SMES i n developing countries to become export-ready). In Eastern Africa a project supported by Finland ITC had achieved success in strengthening value chains in the agricultural sectors in Kenya Tanzania and Zambia and had linked SMEs in those value chains to ex port markets. The Ministry for Foreign Affairs proposes to support ITC technical assistance trustfund (Window I) with two million euros in 2015. The support is targeted in particular to support ITC's activities in Trade and Market Intelligence for SME Comp etitiveness, Strengthening Trade and Investment Support Institutions, Building a Conducive Business Environment, Supporting Regional Economic Integration and South-South Trade.
